==Descriptions==
{{Description|The most popular café in the Vasari Passage, its delicious coffee and snacks have entered plaudits from customers from all walks of life. The owner encourages customers from all backgrounds to freely and comfortably discuss philosophy and other topics as they enjoy their coffee. Anyone may participate, and no topic is forbidden, with the exception of "death".|[[Map]] description}}

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* {{Wt|lucerne#Old_French|''Lucerne''}} is the Old French word for "lantern" or "lamp."
* {{Wt|Lutèce#French|''Lutèce''}} is the French name for the Gallo-Roman town Lutetia Parisiorum, the predecessor of modern Paris.
